page.title: 15Parish Church
page.content: Parts ofthe Parish Church of{St.John {the Evangelist}are pre 1066 and are of Saxon origin.The design is the traditional cruciform shape and there is a fine tower. There are services every day of the week with four on Sundays attendances vary from a mere handful on weekdays to full capacity,300,for the monthly Family Services. Although the church is Anglican there are regular united services with other denominations.The Roman Catholics in the area do not have their own building and so use the Parish Church on a regular basis. The Vicar of the Parish Church is a member of the School Governors and close ties are still maintained despite the closure of the Church School.
